oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 164-168 Second Avenue North architectural survey, 1977-1994
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rhea Building

Architecture; Buildings; Business; Capitol City; Downtown Nashville; Architectural surveys--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture--Details; Architecture--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture, Victorian--Tennessee--Nashville; Buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Central business districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Commercial buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic preservation--Tennessee--Nashville; History--Societies, etc.--Tennessee--Nashville
Nashville (Tenn.)--Buildings, structures, etc.; Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Second Avenue (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Detailed architectural and historical survey of the building spanning the addresses of: 164 Second Avenue North, 166 Second Avenue North, and 168 Second Avenue North, also known as the Rhea Building. Items consist of photographs and documents created from 1977 to 1994. Black and white photographs are of the exterior front or street view of the building, with some views from an angle to the side, sometimes showing adjacent buildings. Several photographs show upper portions of the building and architectural details. Documents contain architectural descriptions, compilations of deed and city directory research, notes from an interview with Angie Donelson, and other research notes. This building was built around 1887. It is made of brick and is three stories tall. Decorative features include friezes, floral designs, and terra cotta elements. Forms part of Historic Nashville Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Historic Nashville, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church St., Nashville, Tennessee 37219
